alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 2:19AM PST until January 09 at 11:46AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. Chehalis River At Centralia affecting Lewis County. Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Grays Harbor and Thurston Counties. .The flood crest on the Chehalis River moved through Porter around 2:30 PM Saturday. The flood crest will arrive at Grays Harbor Sunday afternoon. The river from Porter upstream is receding and with dry weather Sunday into Monday will continue to recede. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Chehalis River At Centralia. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 168.5 feet, the Chehalis River in Lewis County will cause shallow flooding of farm lands and some roads. Roads include Airport Rd, Florida Ave in Chehalis and Military Rd in Centralia. This stage corresponds roughly to a Phase 1 flood in the Lewis County flood warning system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM PST Sunday the stage was 169.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning and will continue to recede into Monday. - Flood stage is 168.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 1015 AM PST.
